import Tabs from "@theme/Tabs";
import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";

# MS SQL Server: Customise auto-generated field names

## Introduction

Hasura auto-generates GraphQL field names based on your database table
and column names. If you'd like to change the defaults, it is possible
to override and rename the auto-generated table and column field names
exposed over the GraphQL API.

:::info Supported from

This feature is supported in versions `v1.0.0-beta.8` and later.

:::

## Expose columns with a different name in the GraphQL API

<Tabs className="api-tabs">
<TabItem value="console" label="Console">

Console support coming soon

</TabItem>
<TabItem value="cli" label="CLI">

You can customize auto-generated field names in the `tables.yaml` file
inside the `metadata` directory:

```yaml {4-6}
- table:
    schema: dbo
    name: author
  configuration:
    custom_column_names:
      addr: address
```

Apply the metadata by running:

```bash
hasura metadata apply
```

</TabItem>
<TabItem value="api" label="API">

A custom field name can be set for a column via the following 2 methods:

1.  Passing a [Table config](/graphql/core/api-reference/syntax-defs.mdx#table-config) with the [CustomColumnNames](/graphql/core/api-reference/syntax-defs.mdx#customcolumnnames) to the
    [mssql_set_table_customization](/graphql/core/api-reference/metadata-api/table-view.mdx#mssql-set-table-customization) API while tracking a table:

    ```http
    POST /v1/metadata HTTP/1.1
    Content-Type: application/json
    X-Hasura-Role: admin

    {
      "type": "mssql_set_table_customization",
      "args": {
        "source": "<db_name>",
        "table": "authors",
        "configuration": {
          "custom_column_names": {
            "id": "AuthorId"
          }
        }
      }
    }
    ```

2.  Customization can be done at the time of creation using
    [mssql_track_table](/graphql/core/api-reference/metadata-api/table-view.mdx#mssql-track-table) API also.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>

## Expose table root fields with a different name in the GraphQL API

<Tabs className="api-tabs">
<TabItem value="console" label="Console">

Console support coming soon

</TabItem>
<TabItem value="cli" label="CLI">

You can expose table root fields with a different name in the GraphQL
API in the `tables.yaml` file inside the `metadata` directory:

```yaml {4-6}
- table:
    schema: dbo
    name: authors
  configuration:
    custom_root_fields:
      select: authors_aggregate
```

After that, apply the metadata by running:

```bash
hasura metadata apply
```

</TabItem>
<TabItem value="api" label="API">

A custom field name can be set for a table root field via the following
2 methods:

1.  Passing a [Table config](/graphql/core/api-reference/syntax-defs.mdx#table-config) with the [Custom Root Fields](/graphql/core/api-reference/syntax-defs.mdx#custom-root-fields) to the
    [mssql_set_table_customization](/graphql/core/api-reference/metadata-api/table-view.mdx#mssql-set-table-customization) API while tracking a table:

    ```http
    POST /v1/metadata HTTP/1.1
    Content-Type: application/json
    X-Hasura-Role: admin

    {
      "type": "mssql_set_table_customization",
      "args": {
        "source": "<db_name>",
        "table": "authors",
        "configuration": {
          "custom_column_names": {
            "id": "AuthorId"
          },
          "custom_root_fields": {
            "select": "authors",
            "select_aggregate": "authors_aggregate"
          }
        }
      }
    }
    ```

2.  Customization can be done at the time of creation using
    [mssql_track_table](/graphql/core/api-reference/metadata-api/table-view.mdx#mssql-track-table) API also.

</TabItem>
</Tabs>
